projectPurpose: To provide a cost-effective, software-based multi-monitor KVM switch solution by using an inexpensive USB switch and controlling monitor inputs via DDC/CI.
mainFeatures: Turns a simple USB switch into a multi-monitor KVM switch
Switches monitor inputs via DDC/CI based on USB device connection/disconnection
Requires installation on all connected computers for bidirectional switching
Supports running external commands on USB connect/disconnect events
Identifies monitors by substring of their ID

marketPositioning: Display-switch is positioned as a cost-effective, open-source alternative to traditional multi-monitor hardware KVM switches. It bridges the gap between software-only KVMs (which only share keyboard/mouse) and expensive hardware KVMs (which also switch displays) by using an inexpensive USB switch for peripheral switching and software-based DDC/CI commands for automatic monitor input switching. This makes it appealing to users seeking multi-monitor control without the significant investment in dedicated KVM hardware, relying instead on software automation and affordable components.
